Package arcade.env.grid

Class AgentGrid

java.lang.Object
arcade.env.grid.AgentGrid
All Implemented Interfaces:
Grid
Direct Known Subclasses:
HexAgentGrid
public abstract class AgentGrid
extends java.lang.Object
implements Grid
Implementation of Grid using Location object as hash.

AgentGrid uses the Location object to map to objects at the location. Methods are written to work regardless of the underlying geometry. An array of boolean flags indicates if positions within a location are occupied.

Since:
2.2
Version:
2.3.0

    • createObject

      abstract sim.util.Bag createObject​(Location loc)
      Creates an empty bag associated with the location.

      The collection and location are added to the locationToBag map.

      Parameters:
      loc - the location
      Returns:
      the empty bag

    • removeObject

      public void removeObject​(java.lang.Object obj)
      Removes an object from the grid.

      Remove the object from all bags and maps. If the location bag is now empty, also remove the bag.

      Specified by:
      removeObject in interface Grid

    • setObjectMaps

      private void setObjectMaps​(java.lang.Object obj, Location loc)
      Updates the location maps.

      The locationToBag maps from the location object to a bag of objects at that location. The locationToFlags maps from the location object to a boolean array of flags denoting which positions at the location are occupied.

      Parameters:
      obj - the object
      loc - the location of the location

    • clearLocation

      private void clearLocation​(Location loc)
      Removes all mappings for a given location.
      Parameters:
      loc - the location
